main: ^Hey Rumyooo, have you tried block coding before?
^Yes, I have. I've been doing it for a little while now.
^Great! Can you tell me what you think about it?
^I think it's a great way to get started with programming. The blocks make it easier to understand the logic behind coding.
^I totally agree! Do you know how block coding can be related to something in the real world?
^Interesting question. Let me think... I think block coding can be related to tilling crops.
^Well, when you till crops, you break up the soil into smaller, manageable pieces. Similarly, with block coding,
^you break down a problem into smaller, manageable blocks of code that can be easily understood and solved.
^That's a great analogy! I've never thought of it that way. Thanks, Rumyooo!
^You're welcome, Von. I'm glad I could help.
